conclusion: The toy car A is driving towards the group of blocks on the right.

When the toy car A collides with the blocks, it will transfer some of its kinetic energy to the blocks.
The blocks will move or be displaced depending on their mass and the force exerted by the car.
The blocks may deflect the car's path, causing it to change direction or stop.

The car will then collide with the orange block next to the blue block.

The car may continue to collide with other blocks, depending on its remaining kinetic energy and deflection effects.
The car will eventually stop when it has exhausted its kinetic energy or is deflected in a way that prevents it from continuing to move.
